scenarios.name: Asteroid 2025-XF11
scenarios.description: A 500-meter diameter asteroid detected 90 days from potential Earth impact. Impact probability: 87%. Your mission: deploy a spacecraft to alter its trajectory using three-body gravitational dynamics.
scenarios.scientificContext: This scenario demonstrates the practical application of three-body orbital mechanics in planetary defense. The Moon's gravitational influence can be leveraged for trajectory corrections.

scenarios.name: Binary Asteroid System
scenarios.description: A binary asteroid system approaching Earth. The larger body is 800m in diameter. Deflecting one will affect both due to mutual gravitational attraction.
scenarios.scientificContext: Binary asteroids represent ~15% of near-Earth objects. Their dynamics follow the restricted three-body problem with the Earth-Moon-Asteroid system.

kinetic.name: Kinetic Impactor
kinetic.description: Direct collision with the asteroid. High delta-V requirement but immediate effect.

gravity.name: Gravity Tractor
gravity.description: Hover near asteroid using gravitational attraction. Low delta-V but requires precise positioning.

explosive.name: Explosive Device
explosive.description: Detonation near surface. Moderate delta-V with area effect. Risky but effective.

missDistanceFormula.description: Exponential curve: base score 100 at 2x safe distance, max 1000 at 10x safe distance

timeEfficiency.description: Completing faster adds multiplier: 1.0 to 2.0 based on time remaining

precisionBonus.description: Intercept within optimal launch window: +250 points
